RH at its core is about taste, and we believe the idea of scaling taste is large and far reaching.

The RH brand attracts the best designers, artisans, manufacturers and talent in our industry, scaling and rendering their work more valuable across our integrated platform, enabling us to curate the most compelling collection of luxury home furnishings in the world. We are moving the brand beyond curating and selling products to conceptualizing and selling spaces by building an ecosystem of products, places, services and spaces that elevates and establishes the RH brand as a global thought leader, taste and place maker.

At RH we believe deeply that the "right" people are our greatest asset. We value people with high energy, who possess the ability to energize others. People who are smart, creative and have a point of view. People who see the answer in every problem, versus those who see the problem in every answer. People who are driven, determined and won't take "no" for an answer. We value team players, people who are more concerned with what's right, rather than who's right.



RH is seeking a Gallery Curator with a passion for design and home furnishings who will lead a cross-functional team focused on strategy and execution. The Curator role is ideal for those with a sense of personal style, polished appearance, refined taste and a discerning eye for luxury. An RH Curator must understand the importance of attracting and retaining talent who also uphold the same personal and professional standards.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

Live Our Vision, Values and Beliefs every day
Develop visual merchandising plans with Gallery Leadership and centralized RH Visual teams to build on strategies and grow the business
Work with internal partners to establish strategies that drive sales and ensure execution according to RH standards
Train Gallery teams on merchandise set, signage and graphics updates, Gallery maintenance, recovery and cleanliness
Learn and communicate the RH design point of view and product assortment
Continuously drive results through team engagement, empowerment and accountability




OUR REQUIREMENTS

5+ years leadership and visual experience within luxury retail
Proven experience embracing change and delivering top results with a positive attitude no matter what the obstacle
Ability to recognize and respond appropriately to complex priorities
Ability to communicate effectively, both in writing and verbally
Curious self-educator who seeks information and asks questions
Strong leadership skills and strategic mentality with experience motivating and leading teams based on business analysis
Experience creating positive and healthy work environments in which people want to do their best
Commitment to quality, detail-focused on all levels




PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Ability to lift and mobilize small to medium items up to 30 lbs. while utilizing appropriate equipment and techniques
Ability to maneuver effectively around gallery floor, stock room and office
Position entails prolonged standing, twisting, stooping, kneeling, squatting, bending and climbing

Company Description


Guardant Health is a leading precision oncology company focused on helping conquer cancer globally through use of its proprietary tests, vast data sets and advanced analytics. The Guardant Health oncology platform leverages capabilities to drive commercial adoption, improve patient clinical outcomes and lower healthcare costs across all stages of the cancer care continuum. Guardant Health has commercially launched Guardant360®, Guardant360 CDx, Guardant360 TissueNext™, Guardant360 Response™, and GuardantOMNI® tests for advanced stage cancer patients, and Guardant Reveal™ for early-stage cancer patients. The Guardant Health screening portfolio, including the Shield™ test, aims to address the needs of individuals eligible for cancer screening.



Job Description


About the Role:

As an Automation Service Engineer at Guardant Health, you will play a critical role in enhancing our operational efficiency and quality standards. You will be responsible for identifying areas for improvement, implementing process enhancements, and driving a culture of continuous improvement within the Automation Service Engineering department. This may include but is not limited to automating and scaling workflows, generating and revising documentation, and prototyping fixtures and tools.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Gather and analyze data related to key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify trends and areas for improvement
Conduct risk assessments to identify potential risks associated with process changes and develop mitigation strategies.
Conduct impact assessments to prioritize improvements
Develop and implement controls and/or metric monitoring capabilities to identify potential issues/trends as they occur.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including scientists, engineers, quality control, and operations, to drive process improvements and ensure alignment with company goals.
Represent the Engineering Group in cross functional meetings
Perform Installation Qualification (IQ), Operational Qualification (OQ), Process Qualification (PQ) on equipment as needed.
Utilize continuous improvement tools and apply Lean Six Sigma principles
Analyze and maintain existing processes and workflows.
Analyze, test, and develop efficient and scalable solutions that align with current business, product, and operational needs
Provide training and support to team members and staff to foster a culture of continuous improvement and ensure the successful implementation of improvement strategies.
Draft and revise documentation as needed for process improvements including Change Requests (CRs), Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and Work Instructions (WIs).
Ensure that all continuous improvement activities comply with regulatory requirements and industry standards.
Support a Quality-first culture by initiating and supporting the improvement and continuation of initiatives driving accuracy and consistent adherence to regulations.
Execute special projects as assigned


Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (biotechnology, engineering, or related).
Must have 2+ years in the Biotech/Pharmaceutical Industry with experience in business analysis and project realization for Clinical Workflows.
Must have 2+ years of experience in Process Engineering, Service Engineering, or a related role
Experience in process improvement initiatives using continuous improvement methodologies with a track record of realized improvements.
Familiarity with streamlining workflows and developing automated laboratory processes and instrumentation systems, including collecting and documenting requirements, developing concepts, design, testing/validation, implementing, and training
Experience operating, troubleshooting, and programming lab instrumentation is a plus.
Ability to identify, analyze and solve problems with minimal direction and make decisions with confidence and in aligment with the business and department goals.
Experience in developing organizational metrics and visual management systems for key performance indicators.
Familiarity with statistical data analysis, monitoring data quality and troubleshooting technical problems
Highly skilled in visualization tools, SharePoint, Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, Project).
Experience working in a rapid-pace startup environment
Has a ‘change-agent’ mindset.
Project management experience is a plus.
Coding experience is a plus
Knowledge of Data Driven Applications and database design, manipulation, and queries, including MySQL is a plus

Additional Information


Hybrid Work Model: At Guardant Health, we have defined days for in-person/onsite collaboration and work-from-home days for individual-focused time. All U.S. employees who live within 50 miles of a Guardant facility will be required to be onsite on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays. We have found aligning our scheduled in-office days allows our teams to do the best work and creates the focused thinking time our innovative work requires. At Guardant, our work model has created flexibility for better work-life balance while keeping teams connected to advance our science for our patients.

For positions based in Palo Alto, CA or Redwood City, CA, the base salary range for this full-time position is $88,000 to $119,000. The range does not include benefits, and if applicable, bonus, commission, or equity.

Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including, but not limited to, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. If you are selected to move forward, the recruiting team will provide details specific to the factors above.

Employee may be required to lift routine office supplies and use office equipment. Majority of the work is performed in a desk/office environment; however, there may be exposure to high noise levels, fumes, and biohazard material in the laboratory environment. Ability to sit for extended periods of time.

We work with complex multinational companies to understand the regulatory landscape and influence business decisions. Minimum overall and major GPA of 3.0/4.0 preferred

Experience working with back end databases and database management systems

Intellectually curious

Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.
At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We’re not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.
As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.
Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.
The Role
We are looking for a product manager for Veeva Labs. Veeva Labs builds innovative applications for Veeva’s own use and for Veeva’s customers. When Veeva has a strategic need for an application better or different than what we see on the market, we work with Veeva’s executive leadership to build it. It’s a special opportunity to build products to the highest standards, with the rewards of building applications that are loved by their users. We also frequently pioneer new technologies and architectures, later used across Veeva. This role has a preference for candidates based in the Pacific or Mountain Time Zones.
What You’ll Do

Design innovative product features across domains and business processes
Author high-quality design specifications within an agile methodology
Prioritize feature development based on strategic initiatives, customer requirements, and internal technical needs
Interact with customers, services, market owners, and sales to understand business needs
Interact with engineering and QA teams to drive high-quality product feature implementation

Requirements

5+ years in a business analyst or product management role
Ability to work independently in a dynamic environment, with little direct supervision
Strong analytic skills: able to develop and test hypotheses from user behavior and other data
Strong communication skills: written, verbal, and formal presentation
Technical skills to translate business requirements into terms that developers can understand

Perks & Benefits

Medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance
Flexible PTO and company paid holidays
Retirement programs
1% charitable giving program

Compensation

Base pay: $100,000 – $150,000
The salary range listed here has been provided to comply with local regulations and represents a potential base salary range for this role. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range above or below, depending on experience and location. We look at compensation for each individual and base our offer on your unique qualifications, experience, and expected contributions. This position may also be eligible for other types of compensation in addition to base salary, such as variable bonus and/or stock bonus.

Sumitomo (SHI) Cryogenics of America, Inc. (SCAI) is looking for an experienced Sales Account Manager to cultivate and grow the SICERA® brand in the Semiconductor market.
SCAI Sales Account Managers manage the customer experience and ensure that customer product and service needs are met through proper solution specifications. They manage the entire sales process from start to finish (from initial inquiry through after sales care), act as the voice of the customer to escalate problems (inside and outside of SCAI) and drive prioritization of business needs.
Qualified candidates are experts when it comes to building strong relationships with strategic customers. They are able to identify needs and requirements in order to promote our company’s solutions and achieve mutual satisfaction. This is a roll-up-your sleeves and get your hands dirty type of role; SCAI Account Managers are regularly involved with every facet of account management.
Qualified candidates have at least five (5) years of customer facing sales experience selling to major semi-conductor customers, a proven track record providing solutions based on customer needs, STELLAR communication, proven ability to influence and direct sales experience managing global accounts with a book of business averaging at least $15M in revenue per year in a semi-conductor environment.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to work in a fast-paced environment where communicating and problem solving are essential to meeting the customer’s needs and expectations.
Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (ideally in Physics, Mechanical, Electrical or Chemical Engineering), Sales, or Business from an accredited four-year college or university and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum five (5) years customer-facing sales experience selling to major semi-conductor customers; must have a proven track record of providing solutions based on customer needs.
Direct Sales experience managing global customer accounts with a book of business averaging at least $15M in revenue per year in a semi-conductor environment.
Solid understanding of the sales process and value selling, as well as proven business analysis skills.
Ability to consistently understand product applications in the customer’s environment.
Excellent problem-solving and project management/planning skills. Understands full scope of issues; sets objectives and meets deadlines.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with aptitude in building relationships with professionals of all organizational levels.
Demonstrated presentation and negotiation skills.
Flexibility to work outside normal office hours as business needs dictate.
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office proficiency are required: (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook email and calendar)
Above average and demonstrated customer service, organizational and communication skills (written, verbal and interpersonal) are required. Demonstrated ability to read, write and speak clearly in English and interface effectively with internal and external customers
Must be able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment where communicating and problem solving are essential to meeting the customer’s needs and expectations on a regular basis.
Proven ability to influence and maintain positive working relationships.
Proven ability to actively listen and use information to solve problems, anticipate issues and make correct decisions based on a variety of situations.
Must be able to work with a wide variety of people with different personalities and backgrounds
Ability & willingness to travel domestically and internationally (up to 10%).
Ability to pass a personal background check and/or clearance at time of hire, and as required by our customers.
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship.

About the SHI Cryogenics Group and Sumitomo (SHI) Cryogenics of America, Inc.
SHI Cryogenics Group, an integral part of the Precision Equipment Division of Sumitomo Heavy Industries, Ltd., is a leading worldwide provider of innovative cryogenic and vacuum solutions to the medical, semiconductor, flat panel, general coating and research industries. With offices in Asia, Europe and the United States, it has been producing quality cryogenic equipment for over 50 years. SHI’s renowned engineering departments continue to focus on the latest cryogenic and vacuum technologies, including innovative cryopump and cryocooler designs. Sumitomo (SHI) Cryogenics of America, Inc. (“SCAI”) is the North American Division of the SHI Cryogenics Group, focusing on design, manufacturing, sales and service with its corporate office in Allentown, PA, and additional locations in Illinois, California, and Texas.

Excellent Healthcare Benefits (well above industry norms)

Excellent Training & Development Benefits

Job Title: Key Account Manager, High Pressure Gases - West
Job Description:

Compensation Includes: Base salary range, monthly commission, annual bonus, and monthly auto allowance with gas reimbursement. Total Compensation potential target is between $130,000 - $165,000 a year (based on national average, this will vary depending on cost of living factor based on candidate location).

High Pressure is one of the focus areas within the Oil Free Air division and is contributing to the division’s strive for more sustainable solutions and thereby contributing to create a better tomorrow. The use and re-use of special gases has been identified as one of the main pillars within High Pressure, as some gases can be rare (Neon), expensive (Argon), limited available (Helium), daily used (Carbon Dioxide) or even create a better and cleaner energy for today or tomorrow (Hydrogen).

For this we are seeking a Regional Key Account Manager, specifically for High Pressure Specialty Gases. The role will support customers requiring high pressure piston compressors and boosters in the industrial gases segment – outside of the Air Separation, Nitrogen and PET market.

Product Sales – Identify, Prospect, build, and maintain quality customer relationships to develop Atlas Copco’s business in the High Pressure Specialty Gases compressor and booster market. Achieve and exceed assigned equipment sales targets by developing and implementing action plans to capture sales from the Key Accounts. Follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from coworker activity and as referred by telemarketing activity. Respond promptly and professionally to customer inquiries. Introduce new products and service upgrades to Key Accounts. Study customer needs and coordinate with Service Sales Managers to fulfill those needs. Actively engage in planned prospecting activities geared at increasing the market share within the key accounts, Key Account Manager owns opportunity through Start Up.

Obtain, develop, or otherwise prepare, deliver, and present sales materials, exhibits, and promotional programs. Prepare for and attend trade shows, exhibits, conferences, meetings, and other local, regional, and national promotional opportunities. Maintain customer base, quotations, and daily calendar.
Prepare and prese

Experience: 5+ years of relevant technical, industrial sales experience a must, preferably in the compressed air and gas industry with engineered high pressure piston compressors.
Education: Four-year degree in business, marketing, engineering or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Are we a good fit?
Must be energetic, proactive and have excellent organizational, interpersonal, and verbal and written communication skills. Must have proven business analysis skills. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office, including Word and Excel. Travel required (up to 50%). Must have a valid driver’s license.
